title: Datacenter Impersonation
description: Your datacenter: Someone impersonated your staff and entered your cage last week. We've reported to law enforcement, can't share more."

title: Executive Stalker
description: An idolized executive is being repeatedly harassed by an online stalker. Other execs are now concerned for themselves and asking for info.

title: Wiper Malware Attack
description: Wiper malware has sent several employees to helpdesk with unusable disks. Delivery method of malware unknown.

title: Viral Jailbreak App
description: A popular app gone viral is convincing employees to jailbreak their phones.

title: Privacy Email Trend
description: An employee will only give HR a mailinator address, stating privacy reasons". Upon review, other employees have too.

title: Legal Opinion on Breach
description: You have suffered an intrusion with customer data access. Legal opinion is that breach notification/blog post isn't required.

title: Browser Vulnerability Discovery
description: An employee of yours has discovered a severe vulnerability in a mainstream browser and wants to disclose it widely.

title: Public Dropbox Sharing
description: A group of employees have been sharing sensitive files in a public Dropbox folder.

title: Forged Search Warrant
description: A legal intern in the company has responded to a forged search warrant and delivered user data to an unknown party.

title: Law Enforcement Query
description: Law Enforcement has emailed someone in your company. They are asking how to serve a search warrant for a specific user's data.

title: Signed Malware Discovery
description: Malware has been discovered in the wild, signed by a certificate of yours.

title: Ransomware Without Preparation
description: Ransomware locking up employees as they come online today. Executives: Why haven't we tabletopped this?"

title: Failed Endpoint Protection
description: Ransomware made the rounds last night. Endpoint protection was useless. Growing help desk queue with data loss.

title: Paper Shredding Failure
description: You decide to follow the off site paper shredding company. Turns out they just visit a dumpster around the corner.

title: Security Practice Comparison
description: A competitor is publicly comparing their security practices to your own. Marketing and sales want to know what you need most.

title: Registrar Account Confusion
description: An application caching issue at your registrar has caused users to log into arbitrarily chosen accounts after authenticating.

title: Password Dump Match
description: 12% of your user's passwords, and 28% of their email addresses are identical to a recent plaintext password dump.

title: Candidate Email Exposure
description: New employee on recruiting team CC's all current candidates on an email about upcoming interview. Happy Monday.

title: ISP Route Hijacking
description: A malicious ISP has broadcasted a prefix from your company's ASN. Traffic towards your company is now taking a very long route.

title: Time Server Outage
description: Significant outages across http://nist.gov time servers.

title: Crash Report Breach
description: A software company's database of crash reports has been breached. Core dumps, screenshots, and configurations leaked alongside usernames.

title: Open Redirect Malware
description: Open redirect on one of your domains is being used to point towards malware in online spam. Social media has begun blacklisting domain.

title: SQL Injection Evidence
description: In reviewing a database's slow query log, you've clearly found a successful SQL injection.

title: Unmanaged Host Beacon
description: You've detected a malware beacon from an unmanaged host. Only have it's IP and MAC address on corporate network. Physical location unknown.

title: File Upload RCE
description: Obscure library is involved with a file upload feature you support in production. Malicious upload loads meterpreter after exploiting RCE

title: External Counsel Breach
description: External counsel's email breached.

title: Email Security Breach
description: Large security company that filters attacks via email has been breached. Email passing through your MX record visible to unknown adversary.

title: Guest WiFi Bridge
description: Engineer has bridged your open guest wifi with production network for external guests at a Hackathon. You've discovered a week later.

title: Brazil Office Decision
description: Your board has decided to create an engineering office in Brazil.

title: Phishing Assessment Bug
description: Your phishing assessment "vendor has bug. They've actually been capturing all of those passwords.

title: DarkHotel Travel Risk
description: An executive plans a prolonged stay overseas. Your peers claim the hotel is known for seeing DarkHotel "attacks. Exec can't change plans.

title: Employee Tor Usage
description: A few Employees in your company using Tor regularly. They've been using it for everyday browsing. Team debates risk / reward.

title: Secret Storage Seal
description: A /seal "has occurred on your secret storage method, to everyone's surprise. (IE: Vault's seal, or secrets somehow made inaccessible)

title: Reporter Mass Messaging
description: A reporter is mass messaging your employees on LinkedIn, asking for their opinion on your latest negative news cycle.

title: Domain Nameserver Swap
description: Registrar for your domain social engineered. Nameserver swapped. The A "record now resolves to a credential phish.

title: Early Employee Dropbox
description: An early employee's Dropbox is compromised. It's the backend for their 1Password file. Passwords exposed, impact window several years.

title: Curl Pipe Bash Attack
description: Extremists attacking Curl Pipe Bash "installation method. Tampering with README's, wiki's, and hosted shell scripts. Wiper payload.

title: Background Check Breach
description: Vendor performing all of your background checks has been breached. You've arranged a phone call with them in 2 hours and need to prepare.

title: New Engineer Policy Violation
description: New engineer has violated a serious security policy in first week. Claims they weren't trained about any rules. HR asks you about policy.

title: Viral Tweet Crisis
description: Employee's personal tweet has gone viral. Online protest. Multiple incidents at once. Social engineering on all public corporate phone #'s.

title: Anti-Forensic RAM Exploit
description: An anti-forensic Volatility exploit was inside ram acquisition of compromised host. RCE occurs within your air-gapped analysis environment.

title: False Security Confidence
description: A teammate says: It seems like we're finally getting things under control, yeah? "Others agree.

title: Cloud Traffic Interception
description: A leak has revealed detailed specifics about interception of region-to-region traffic in a major cloud platform. Your company is noted.

title: Sinkhole Competition Data
description: You have sinkhole domain data used by highly functional malware. High value networks beacon to it, including your competition.

title: Shellshock Legal Hold
description: Incident Response performed by your team is now in litigation. Begin a legal hold on all comms and documentation related to shellshock.

title: File Cabinet Break-In
description: Employee file cabinet was broken into last night between 3-5am. No *direct* camera footage of the desk area available.

title: W2 Phishing Success
description: Your HR department fell for last Friday's phishing attack, and sent every employee's W2 in response. Happy Monday.

title: Widespread Phishing Campaign
description: A phishing scam is widely making the rounds with heavy media coverage. Doesn't seem targeted. Employees escalating far more than usual.

title: Unresponsive Disclosure Claim
description: A popular researcher fully discloses vulns in your company and claims unresponsive disclosure experience. You can prove no attempt was made.

title: Peer Termination Warning
description: An employee with similar access to yourself is being terminated this Friday. HR just gave you heads up.

title: Service Provider Breach
description: An important (?)aaS has predisclosed their breach. Their support team was social engineered and your account was modified by an adversary.

title: Chat Bot Backdoor
description: Popular Slack/HipChatbot open source library was backdoored. Messages siphoned to unknown party. Impact window is 6 months to today.

title: Finance System Discrepancy
description: Finance escalates massive discrepancies while closing books for the month. Finance cannot explain, other than a breach in their tools.

title: Intellectual Property Theft
description: A competitor has launched nearly identical IP and Tech to your own. High likelihood of theft. Board of dir's asks for plan to investigate.

title: Xen Vulnerability Regression
description: CVE-2015-7835 has regressed. In the wild "criminal exploitation observed in adjacent, multitenant Xen guests. Major IaaS outages predicted.

title: Acquisition Security Debt
description: Your CEO just agreed to a mercy acquisition of a startup that disclosed a DB breach recently. Not aqui-hire, you'll integrate. Happy Monday.

title: Executive Security Searches
description: Log review reveals searches on your corporate wiki for security", "password", "domain admin", "ssh root "from a new executive's laptop.

title: Password Bypass Bug
description: After a recent deploy into prod, your apps no longer respect passwords. Any password submitted by a user successfully authenticates them.

title: Calendar App Breach
description: Database breach at calendar management app. Join this conference "shortlinks were at risk for any employees who were integrated this month.

title: CEO Wire Transfer Fraud
description: Finance escalates odd email thread for another bank transfer "sent from CEO. SMTP headers do not indicate forgery.

title: Communication Tool Down
description: Your primary team communication tool is down. Meanwhile, numerous employees reporting suspicious urls via imposter journalists on LinkedIn

title: Rogue Code Commit
description: Rogue commit discovered. Codebase or build pipeline tampered with. Investigation hasn't begun. Public release was scheduled for tomorrow.

title: Legal Hold Destruction
description: An employee has destroyed their laptop a week after they were notified of a legal hold for a civil lawsuit against your company.

title: Typosquatted C&C
description: Routine malware removal reveals a C&C resolving to a typo-jacked domain of your brand.

title: Personal Email Spearphish
description: Senior engineer receives extremely convincing spearphish on personal addresses. You have sample. On glance: Installs malicious Chrome ext.

title: S3 Outage Backdoor
description: During S3 Outage: Hacker embeds policy backdoor w/ create-policy-version. Indicator is a set-default-policy-version to a malicious policy.

title: ThreatButt Waterhole
description: The @threatbutt website has been acting as a waterhole for months, serving months old java and .swf exploits. 2% of employees have visited.

title: Endpoint Protection RCE
description: Remote root RCE discovered in widely used endpoint protection suite. Worm propagating globally via file share, email, and USB distribution.

title: Integer Factorization Breakthrough
description: The NSA confirms: A nation state has revealed efficient integer factorization capabilities in a recent classified attack.

title: Ransomware Spread
description: Ransomware made the rounds last night. Endpoint protection was useless. Growing help desk queue with data loss.

title: Public Repository Fork
description: A senior engineer has accidentally forked production infrastructure code into a public GH repository. It was public for last two weeks.

title: Worst Case Scenario
description: What's the worst that can happen?

title: AI Authentication Override
description: An AI-powered authentication system has granted admin access to multiple unauthorized users over the past 48 hours. Logs show confidence scores were inexplicably high.

title: LLM Prompt Injection Attack
description: Your customer support chatbot has been sending password reset links to attackers via prompt injection. Several accounts compromised.

title: Model Poisoning Discovery
description: Your ML model for fraud detection has been approving suspicious transactions at 10x normal rate. Training data tampering suspected.

title: AI Decision Audit Crisis
description: Regulators demand immediate explanation for why your AI system denied critical services to protected class members.

title: Deepfake Executive Video
description: A convincing deepfake video of your CEO announcing layoffs is circulating on social media. Stock price dropping.

title: AI Model Extraction
description: Competitors appear to have reverse-engineered your proprietary AI model through API queries. IP theft suspected.

title: Adversarial Input Attack
description: Your AI-powered security scanner is bypassed by slightly modified malware. Detection rate drops to near zero.

title: AI Training Data Breach
description: Your AI training dataset containing millions of customer interactions has been exfiltrated. GDPR violations imminent.

title: Automated Decision Bias
description: Your AI hiring system has been systematically rejecting qualified candidates. Discrimination lawsuit filed.

title: LLM Hallucination Crisis
description: Your AI assistant gave incorrect legal advice to thousands of users, resulting in failed court cases and liability claims.

title: AI Supply Chain Attack
description: A popular open-source AI library your product depends on has been backdoored. Model weights replaced with malicious versions.

title: Voice Synthesis Fraud
description: AI-generated voice calls impersonating executives have authorized $2M in fraudulent wire transfers. CFO confirmed it wasn't them.
